Clip.Title: GALLIPOLI
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Recalling the epic World War 1 battle and the history-changing outcome for Australia, New Zealand and Turkey.

Clip.Title: THE DIGGER
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Told through a sequence of pivotal battles spanning the globe, follow the rise of these tough-as-nails soldiers and their well-earned reputation for wartime heroics and off-duty insubordination.

Clip.Title: GALLIPOLI
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Recalling the epic World War 1 battle and the history-changing outcome for Australia, New Zealand and Turkey.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A journey along Nova Scotia's Bay of Fundy coastline is a cultural and geological marvel - from historic Acadian Villages, to world-famous stone formations - rising from the sea.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An aerial survey over New Brunswick's Bay of Fundy coastline explores geological wonders, the loyalist city of Saint John and international borders beyond and one of the world's most famous waterways.

Clip.Title: CANADA 1812: FORGED IN FIRE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An east coast shipper creates a private naval fleet to seize American ships.

Clip.Title: CANADA 1812: FORGED IN FIRE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Americans are invading and Lower Canada is undermanned, forcing Charles de Salaberry to rely on cunning tactics.

Clip.Title: WARSHIPS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

Clip.Title: THE SILK ROAD
Clip.Episode: The Flame and Cross: The South Caucasus
Clip.EpisodeSummary: 25 years after first filming the route, the original film crew returns to the region for a modern look.

Clip.Title: JEFFERSON'S SECRET BIBLE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Experts at Smithsonian Institution's National Museum of American History are trying 200 years later, to preserve Jefferson's secret bible, a book he constructed by cutting apart the New Testament to tell a chronological story of Jesus's life, parables, and moral instruction, removing all mention of miracles and the resurrection.

Clip.Title: SHACKLETON'S FROZEN HELL
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In 1914, the world's first trans-Antarctic expedition came to a cold stop. Trapped in ice just 60 miles from their destination, explorer Ernest Shackleton and his crew found themselves in a dire situation that would play out as a two-year battle against starvation, sub-zero conditions, and the threat of being swallowed by the unforgiving Southern Ocean.

Clip.Title: WARSHIPS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Vancouver Island's Western Coastline is a collection of scenic towns, parks and coastal rainforest unique in the world - from Tofino, to Pacific Rim National Park Reserve, and Clayoquot Sound UNESCO Biosphere Reserve.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Zoom above some of America's greatest landcapes and monuments in stunning HD realism.

Clip.Title: TERROR IN THE SKIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Passengers' videos show flights endangered by various forces of nature, and raise questions about how prepared we really are to fly against the elements.

Clip.Title: CIVIL WAR 360
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Take a journey back in time and immerse yourself in a 150-year-old battle that nearly split our nation in two. This three-part series explores famous and little known aspects of the Civil War, from the perspectives of the Union, the Confederacy and the millions of enslaved people struggling for freedom. Hosted by Ashley Judd, Trace Adkins, and Dennis Haysbert, all of whom had ancestors greatly affected by the war, this series delivers fresh insights and untold tales, brought to life through dramatic recreations and the Smithsonian Institution's vast collection of artifacts.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Zoom above some of America's greatest landcapes and monuments in stunning HD realism.
